snippet: A report said two senior executives at the Bank of Cyprus might have deleted documents related to the decision to invest in Greek government bonds just before Greece’s bailout in 2010.
abstract: Internal report commissioned by Bank of Cyprus finds that senior executives Andreas Eliades and Christakis Patsalides may have deleted crucial documents in 2012 related to bank's disastrous decision to invest heavily in Greek government bonds on eve of 2010 bailout.
lead_paragraph: A report said two senior executives at the Bank of Cyprus might have deleted documents related to the decision to invest in Greek government bonds just before Greece’s bailout in 2010.

headline.main: Ex-Bank Officials Named in Cyprus Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Ex-Bank Officials Named in Cyprus Inquiry
